title: Update landing-page copy for connection and benefits; reorder Readiness section near top

requirements.text: Update the “After the Session” copy in the “What to Expect from The Clearing” section (frontend/src/components/WhatToExpect.tsx) to remove the statement that there is “no ongoing relationship,” and replace it with wording that (a) clearly avoids client dependency and (b) still welcomes/permits ongoing connection (e.g., future contact or staying connected) in a bounded, non-dependent way. Use English for all user-facing text.

quotes: Let's change the copy that says in "after the session" that there will be no "on-going" relationship. While I don't want my clients to be dependent on my offerings, I do want to establish connections with them.

acceptanceCriteria: In frontend/src/components/WhatToExpect.tsx under the “After the Session” subsection, the phrase asserting “no ongoing relationship” (or equivalent) is removed.
Replacement text explicitly communicates that clients should not become dependent on the practitioner/offering.
Replacement text explicitly communicates that ongoing connection/contact is welcome/possible (within appropriate boundaries), without implying an obligation or dependency.
All updated copy is in English.

requirements.text: Reorder the landing-page sections so the “Readiness” section (currently rendered by frontend/src/components/WhoThisIsFor.tsx) appears immediately after the “Foundation” section (frontend/src/components/WhatItIs.tsx) near the top of the landing page. Implement by updating the render order in frontend/src/App.tsx without removing any sections.

quotes: let's put the "Readiness" section right after the Foundation section at the top.

acceptanceCriteria: In frontend/src/App.tsx, <WhoThisIsFor /> is rendered immediately after <WhatItIs />.
No landing-page section components are deleted; only ordering is changed.
The page still renders all sections (Hero, WhatItIs, WhoThisIsFor/Readiness, WhatToExpect, SessionStructure, PractitionerAuthority, PriceAndValue, EthicsAndBoundaries, ReadyToBookCTA, Footer).

requirements.text: Revise the copy in the “What to Expect from The Clearing” section (frontend/src/components/WhatToExpect.tsx) to more strongly and concretely communicate the immense opportunity/value and specific practical benefits of the session, while still maintaining readiness-filtering language and an informative (not “seductive”) tone. Use practical, tangible, visible, helpful outcome language (e.g., clarity on decisions, naming the real issue, identifying next steps, seeing patterns/choices). Use English for all user-facing text.

quotes: let's add some immense value and highlights to the benefits of this offering in the "What to Expect From the Clearing" copy part.

stress and let it be known the availability of the immense opportunity and value and specific practical benefits there can be gained from The Clearing experience - not to seduce them, but to inform them in practical, tangible, visible, helpful ways the impact the clarity this offering can provide will provide them with.

acceptanceCriteria: frontend/src/components/WhatToExpect.tsx contains updated/expanded copy that clearly enumerates concrete, practical benefits/outcomes a participant can expect from the session.
The revised copy preserves a readiness filter (e.g., requiring willingness to engage, responsibility, discomfort tolerance) and does not read as hype-driven or manipulative.
The updated copy remains consistent with existing constraints already stated in the section (non-predictive tarot, not therapy, active engagement, not recorded, 90-minute session).
All revised/added user-facing text is in English.

constraints: Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui (compose existing UI components only).
Do not change application functionality (copy and section ordering only).
nonGoals: Do not add new booking/payment features or change Stripe/availability behavior.
Do not change authentication or access-gating behavior.
Do not redesign the overall visual theme beyond what is necessary to accommodate the reordered section and updated copy.
